qas.question: During which century did Matisse work?
Placing red and green next to each other causes their color to be what?
What color did Matisse say could penetate ones soul?
What color did Matisse claim would impact ones blood pressure?
What part in the paintings of Matisse did color play?
Who was the first to make color the central element of the painting?
What theory did Matisse say his choice of colors was based on?
Who was the first 20th century artist to use color for feelings?

context: <b5_0><b7_0>Matisse<b7_0/><b5_0/> was also one of the first <a0_0>20th<a0_0/>-century artists to make color <a4_0>the central element<a4_0/> of the painting, chosen to evoke emotions. "A certain <a2_0>blue<a2_0/> penetrates your soul", he wrote. "A certain <a3_0>red<a3_0/> affects your blood pressure." He also was familiar with the way that complementary colors, such as red and green, <a1_0>strengthened<a1_0/> each other when they were placed next to each other. He wrote, "My choice of colors is not based on <b6_0>scientific theory<b6_0/>; it is based on observation, upon feelings, upon the real nature of each experience ... I just try to find a color which corresponds to my feelings."
